Texts.Chs:
样本报告#33621A

y样本J-11对我们所有人来说都是一个谜团，这也正是它作为生物武器如此有前途的原因。几乎是偶然，我们发现它有能力喷火，从躯干和肩膀挤出尖刺。至少，我们*认为*他们是肩膀。我们已经向相关家庭发出了标准的慰问信。
Texts.Eng:
SPECIMEN REPORT #33621A

Specimen J-11 is an engima to us all, and that's exactly what makes it so promising as a bioweapon. We discovered, almost by accident, that it had the ability to spew fire and extrude spikes from its torso and shoulders the other day. At least, we THINK they're shoulders. Standard condolences letters have been dispatched to the appropriate families.

Texts.Chs: 关于J-11最有希望也是最令人担忧的事情是，它所有的生命迹象似乎都指向一个事实，那就是在这个巨大的生物体内还有其他东西在生长——这只野兽似乎只是一个蛹，一旦它完全成熟，它将在蜕皮的过程中从毫无生气的外壳中出现。进一步的检查是绝对必要的。
Texts.Eng: The most promising - and alarming thing about J-11 is that all of its lifesigns appear to point to the fact that there is something else growing in this monstrous creature - that this beast appears to be a mere chrysalis, and that once whatever it is has fully matured, it will emerge from the lifeless husk in an act of ecdysis. Further examination is definitely warranted.

Texts.Chs: 我们已经下令对J-11采取最大限度的封锁措施。在泽塔天鹅座II发生的事情将不会重演。足够的时间和金钱已经浪费在挫折和不幸上; 高层管理希望尽快得到结果。c成果已经出现，但我们需要小心。
Texts.Eng: We've ordered maximum containment measures for J-11. There will be no repeat of what happened at Zeta Cygnus II. Enough time and money have already been wasted on setbacks and unfortunate incidents; senior management wants results, and soon. These results are already in sight, but we need to be careful.
